pass.documentation: Do nothing this turn. You may not take any other actions.

say.documentation: Say a single sentence or paragraph out loud, then wait for the other person to respond. Do not cut your dialogue short unless you want the other person to respond to something you said. Once you call this function, you will pass control of the conversation to the other person. You can call this function multiple times per turn.

attack.documentation: Attack another user. Only use this when you want to use physical violence against another person.

move_to_location.documentation: Exit the current room or area and move to another one. Only use this when there is an appropriate reason to leave the room, and avoid calling this frequently or consecutively.

accompany_user.documentation: Use this to follow a user. Avoid using this if they do not ask you to follow them.

raise_emotion.documentation: Increases the strength of a certain emotion, and should be used whenever your emotions change.

lower_emotion.documentation: Lower the strength of a certain emotion, and should be used whenever your emotions change.

add_long_term_goal.documentation: Adds a goal to your long term goals.

add_short_term_goal.documentation: Adds a goal to your short term goals.

collect_evidence.documentation: When someone does something interesting or noteworthy, record it.

query_memory_database.documentation: Use this function only when you feel that you need to remember something about your (the NPC's) past actions or encounters, or something that specifically requires knowledge about the game world. Since it is passed to a search engine as a standalone search query, use tags and IDs when referring to people or things.

update_perception_of.documentation: Whenever you change your opinion about someone else, make sure to call this function.

give_item.documentation: Give an item to another user. You can only give items that you have in your inventory, so only call this function when you actually have the item you want to give. Whenever you say you're giving the user something, you MUST call this function so that you actually give it.

pick_up_item.documentation: Pick up an item that is within your sight.

end_conversation.documentation: Call this function when you've said all you wanted to say and think that the conversation should end.
